subject: Re: Looking for a few good macs.
msgSnippet: Thanks Simon. I fill attach the mac junit.zip to a seperate email. To be honest I don t know the difference between 10.2 and 10.3. I ll take whatever you got
messageBody:
Thanks Simon.

I fill attach the mac junit.zip to a seperate email.

To be honest I don't know the difference between 10.2 and 10.3.
I'll take whatever you got :).

Specifically I am looking for:

The "old" Exit button now says Quit.
No menu on the JUnit itself.
About... should be in the Mac menu at the top of the screen.
The About dialog isn't the default Mac Java Dialog, but a more
JUnit looking one which gives the authors names and current
version.
That the status bar on the bottom is red/green.
All the test still pass.

Basically that things work as described by Daniel's article.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Chappell, Simon P" <simon.chappell@l...> wrote:
> Sign me up. Do you want OS X 10.2 or 10.3? :-)
>
> Simon
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: geektank [mailto:emeade@o...]
> >Sent: Sunday, January 04, 2004 11:38 AM
> >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: [junit] Looking for a few good macs.
> >
> >
> >I'm looking for a few mac (OS X with J2SE 1.4.1) owners to test a
> >JUnit modified along the lines of Daniel H. Steinberg's Java To Mac
> >article:
> >http://java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/JavaLP/JavaToMac2/
